original: sahāyaṁ nādhigacchati.🔽Nādeyyesu dadaṁ dānaṁ,🔽deyyesu yo pavecchati;
analyzed: sahāyam na adhigacchati  nādeyyesu dadam dāna  deyyesu yaḥ pavecchati
translated: one does not find a friend.🔽Giving to the deserving,🔽not giving to the undeserving,
Seeing the difference between a promise and enjoyment,
one is lost among the dishonest and unrighteous;
But what is done among the righteous and noble,
even a little is of great fruit.
what is difficult to do in the world,
later may or may not do it,
but is always worthy of worship.”
The Great Assa-Mounter Birth Story is the second.
